bibl.title: Military Orders for Jefferson Randolph Kean and Lawrence [Walter L.] Reed, September 24, 1900

div1.p: Special Orders #50 assigns Kean and Reed to a board of survey. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Military Orders for Jefferson Randolph Kean and Lawrence [Walter L.] Reed, September 24, 1900
div1.p:
NOTED: RETURNS, A. G. O.,
9

Adjutant General's
OFFICE.
OCT 11 1900
ROLLS DIVISION.
[unclear]

ORDERS, BOOKS, BLANKS & D.C. DIV.
A. G. O.
RECD. OCT 6 1900

FROM THE NATIONAL ARCHIVES
Vol 247 A

SPECIAL ORDERS, }
No. 50. }

HEADQUARTERS DEPT. OF WESTERN CUBA.
Quemados, September 24, 1900.
1. A board of survey, to consist of:
Major George M. Dunn, Judge Advocate, U. S. V.;
Major J. R. Kean, Surgeon, U. S. V.;
Acting Assistant Surgeon Freeman Allen, U. S. Army;

will assemble at these headquarters at 2 o'clock P. M. to-
day, or as soon thereafter as practicable, to inventory the
public property and funds for which the late Major George
S. Cartwright, Quartermaster, U. S. V., Chief Quartermas-
ter and Disbursing Officer at these headquarters, was ac-
countable.

The board will make the customary returns therefor,
carefully complying with the provisions of A. R. 84 and
Circular No. 36, Headquarters of the Army, A. G. O., se-
ries 1899.

2. Pursuant to instructions contained in an endorsement
dated Headquarters Division of Cuba, September 22, 1900,
a board of survey, to consist of:
Captain Robert C. Van Vliet, 10th Infantry;
1st Lieutenant Eleutheros H. Cook, 10th Infantry;

2d Lieutenant Walter L. Reed, 10th Infantry;
✓

will assemble at the office of the Depot Quartermaster,
Cienfuegos, Cuba, at 10 o'clock A. M., Friday, the 28th
instant, or as soon thereafter as practicable, to investigate
and report upon the damaged condition of certain quarter-
master's supplies reported by Major R. W. Hoyt, 10th In-
fantry, Depot Quartermaster, as received at that Depot
from posts abandoned at Sancti Spiritus, Trinidad, Sagua
la Grande and Caibarien; also any other articles of clothing
found damaged at the Cienfuegos Depot.
BY COMMAND OF BRIGADIER GENERAL LEE:

R. E. L. MICHIE,
Assistant Adjutant General.
